intro: Thlaspi inornatum, commonly known as the smooth wallflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and features small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are usually lance-shaped, with a rough texture. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. Thlaspi inornatum is known for its ability to survive in harsh environmental conditions due to its adaptive traits.
